intro: Waitzia fucata, commonly known as the green alga, is a marine green alga belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus that grows in dense mats on rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a simple morphology with a single layer of cells and lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. It reproduces both sexually and asexually through the production of gametes and spores. Waitzia fucata plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
